required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: D-dimer Levels in Pregnant With COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of D-dimer Levels in Pregnant Women Diagnosed With COVID-19

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: D-dimer measurements act as a global indicator of coagulation and activation of fibrinolytic systems. An optimal cut-off value for D-dimer and its effect on prognosis has not yet been assessed to predict mortality in admission. Therefore, studies comparing D-dimer values of COVID-19 patients and healthy pregnant women are needed. Our study gives us the opportunity to make this comparison.

primary_outcome.measure: Compare D-dimer values of COVID-19 patients and healthy pregnant women

intervention.description: Blood samples will be taken from the patients and will be examined by the ELISA method.

study_pop.textblock: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital Obstetrics and Gynecology Clinic Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women with COVID-19
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having a chronic disease that raises D-dimer levels

facility.name: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

reference.citation: Gutiérrez García I, Pérez Cañadas P, Martínez Uriarte J, García Izquierdo O, Angeles Jódar Pérez M, García de Guadiana Romualdo L. D-dimer during pregnancy: establishing trimester-specific reference intervals. Scand J Clin Lab Invest. 2018 Oct;78(6):439-442. doi: 10.1080/00365513.2018.1488177. Epub 2018 Jul 5.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
